original: @327a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @327a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: panytsa kra ma n'a ma /
analyzed: panytsa kra ma n'a ma /
translated: Pañcakrama-nāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rim pa lnga pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rim pa lnga pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Five Stages

original: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo /
analyzed: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo /
translated: Homage to glorious Hevajra.

original: rnal 'byor pas thog mar bskyed pa'i rim pa rdzogs nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas thog mar bskyed pa'i rim pa rdzogs nas /
translated: A yogi, having first completed the generation stage,

original: rim pa lnga pa'i don la 'jug par bya dgos te /
analyzed: rim pa lnga pa'i don la 'jug par bya dgos te /
translated: must enter into the meaning of the five stages.

original: de yang dang por lus la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rtsa dang // 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar yin pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dang por lus la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rtsa dang // 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar yin pa shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should first understand the characteristics of the channels, cakras, and so on that naturally exist in the body.

original: de ni rgyud kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyud kyi rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of the tantra.

original: de'i 'og tu phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad gtum mo spar la bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad gtum mo spar la bsreg par bya'o //
translated: After that, all conceptual thoughts of the aggregates, constituents, sense bases, and so on should be burned in the blazing fierce fire.

original: de ltar bsregs pas 'dar ba la sogs pa'i rtags brgyad 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsregs pas 'dar ba la sogs pa'i rtags brgyad 'byung ste /
translated: By burning in that way, the eight signs such as trembling will arise.

original: de yang phyi nang gi dngos po la bltas kyang 'dar ba la sogs pa'i rtags brgyad byung na /
analyzed: de yang phyi nang gi dngos po la bltas kyang 'dar ba la sogs pa'i rtags brgyad byung na /
translated: Moreover, if the eight signs such as trembling arise even when looking at outer and inner things,

original: gtum mo 'phro bcad la sems kyis mnan par bya'o //
analyzed: gtum mo 'phro bcad la sems kyis mnan par bya'o //
translated: Having stopped the movement of candall, one should suppress it with the mind.

original: de ni sngags kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sngags kyi rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of mantra.

original: de ltar mnan pas lus kyi bde ba rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mnan pas lus kyi bde ba rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: By suppressing it in this way, the bliss of the body will increase.

original: de ltar bde ba la yang nas yang du bsgoms pas spyi bo nas rkang mthil yan chad du bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bde ba la yang nas yang du bsgoms pas spyi bo nas rkang mthil yan chad du bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, by repeatedly cultivating bliss, bliss will arise from the crown of the head to the soles of the feet.

original: de ltar skyes pa'i tshe phyi'i rtsva shing la sogs pa la dmigs kyang nang gi bde ba skye skye'i bar du de bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar skyes pa'i tshe phyi'i rtsva shing la sogs pa la dmigs kyang nang gi bde ba skye skye'i bar du de bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When it arises in this way, even if one focuses on external grass, trees, and so on, one should cultivate that until inner bliss arises again and again.

original: de ni ye shes kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ye shes kyi rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of wisdom.

original: de ltar gong ltar dmigs kyang bde ba skye ba'i tshe bde ba de nyid kyang skad cig ma snga ma la ni 'gags /
analyzed: de ltar gong ltar dmigs kyang bde ba skye ba'i tshe bde ba de nyid kyang skad cig ma snga ma la ni 'gags /
translated: In this way, even if one focuses as before, when bliss arises, that bliss itself ceases in the previous moment.

original: phyi ma ni ma 'ongs /
analyzed: phyi ma ni ma 'ongs /
translated: The subsequent [moment] has not yet come.

original: da ltar ni skad cig ma gnyis par mi sdod cing mi gnas pas bde ba la rang bzhin med de //
analyzed: da ltar ni skad cig ma gnyis par mi sdod cing mi gnas pas bde ba la rang bzhin med de //
translated: Since the present does not remain or endure in the second moment, bliss is essenceless.

original: bde ba mi dmigs @327b par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba mi dmigs @327b par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the non-observation of bliss.

original: de ni gsang ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gsang ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of the secret.

original: de ltar mi dmigs par bsgoms pas rang gi lus mi dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs par bsgoms pas rang gi lus mi dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, by meditating on non-observation, one's body becomes unobservable.

original: de la phyi nang gi dngos po la bltas kyang lus mi dmigs na phyi nang gi chos thams cad bde ba chen po dang / tha mi dad par gcig tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la phyi nang gi dngos po la bltas kyang lus mi dmigs na phyi nang gi chos thams cad bde ba chen po dang / tha mi dad par gcig tu shes par bya ste /
translated: Looking at external and internal things, if the body is not observed, one should understand that all external and internal phenomena are one, inseparable from great bliss.

original: de mi dmigs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de mi dmigs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on their non-observation.

original: de ltar yang nas yang du bsgoms pas phyi nang gi chos thams cad dang bde ba chen po tha mi dad par mngon sum du shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang nas yang du bsgoms pas phyi nang gi chos thams cad dang bde ba chen po tha mi dad par mngon sum du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: By meditating in this way again and again, one will directly understand that all external and internal phenomena are inseparable from great bliss.

original: de ni gnyis su med pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gnyis su med pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of non-duality.

original: de ltar rim pa lnga la 'jug cing slob pa'i tshe dbang po mi dgag cing yan par btang /
analyzed: de ltar rim pa lnga la 'jug cing slob pa'i tshe dbang po mi dgag cing yan par btang /
translated: When engaging in and training in the five stages in this way, one should not block the sense faculties but let them be relaxed.

original: dbang po'i spyod yul thams cad bde ba dang gcig tu shes par byas la /
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul thams cad bde ba dang gcig tu shes par byas la /
translated: One should understand that all objects of the sense faculties are one with bliss,

original: mi dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs par bya'o //
translated: and one should meditate on their non-observation.

original: 'gro nyal 'dug sdod spyod lam thams cad du 'gying bag dang ldan par byas la /
analyzed: 'gro nyal 'dug sdod spyod lam thams cad du 'gying bag dang ldan par byas la /
translated: In all activities of going, lying, sitting, and staying, one should be endowed with grace.

original: bde ba chen po dang mi 'bral bar bya'o //🔽kha zas la sogs pa'i btung ba'i bye brag thams cad bde ba chen po dang gcig tu shes par byas la bza'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po dang mi 'bral bar bya'o // kha zas la sogs pa'i btung ba'i bye brag thams cad bde ba chen po dang gcig tu shes par byas la bza'o //
translated: One should not be separated from great bliss.🔽One should eat all the various foods and drinks, having made them into one with great bliss.

original: bgo ba'i bye brag thams cad bde ba chen po dang tha mi dad par shes par byas la bgo'o //
analyzed: bgo ba'i bye brag thams cad bde ba chen po dang tha mi dad par shes par byas la bgo'o //
translated: One should wear all the various clothes, having made them into one with great bliss.

original: de ltar byas nas bsgom pa'i tshe lus mi 'gul zhing brtan par gyur na sems zin pa'i rtags yin te bzang /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas bsgom pa'i tshe lus mi 'gul zhing brtan par gyur na sems zin pa'i rtags yin te bzang /
translated: If one does it that way, when one meditates, if the body does not move and becomes stable, that is a sign of the mind being held, and it is good.

original: lus 'khor zhing g-yon rlung zin pa'i rtags yin te bzang //
analyzed: lus 'khor zhing g-yon rlung zin pa'i rtags yin te bzang //
translated: If the body turns and the left vāyu is held, that is a sign of the vāyu being held, and it is good.

original: sems dran pa med de myos par gyur na /
analyzed: sems dran pa med de myos par gyur na /
translated: If the mind is without mindfulness and becomes intoxicated,

original: bde ba'i ros myos pa yin te bzang /
analyzed: bde ba'i ros myos pa yin te bzang /
translated: that is intoxication with the taste of bliss, and it is good.

original: rang dbang med par dgod cing dbyangs dang gar la sogs pa 'byung na bde ba chen po rgyas pa'i rtags yin te bzang /
analyzed: rang dbang med par dgod cing dbyangs dang gar la sogs pa 'byung na bde ba chen po rgyas pa'i rtags yin te bzang /
translated: If one uncontrollably laughs and sings and dances, that is a sign of the increase of great bliss, and it is good.

original: lus sbrid cing ber ber byed na bde ba phan tshun bskyod pa'i rtags yin te bzang /
analyzed: lus sbrid cing ber ber byed na bde ba phan tshun bskyod pa'i rtags yin te bzang /
translated: If the body tingles and vibrates, that is a sign of the mutual movement of bliss, and it is good.

original: 'od zer lnga kha dog la sogs pa mngon sum du mthong na ye shes lnga skye ba'i rtags yin te bzang bud med kyi gzugs su byas nas dbyangs dang gar la sogs pa mdun du byed cing mthong na mkha' 'gro ma 'du ba'i rtags yin te bzang /
analyzed: 'od zer lnga kha dog la sogs pa mngon sum du mthong na ye shes lnga skye ba'i rtags yin te bzang bud med kyi gzugs su byas nas dbyangs dang gar la sogs pa mdun du byed cing mthong na mkha' 'gro ma 'du ba'i rtags yin te bzang /
translated: If one sees a beautiful woman, who sings, dances, and so on, in front of oneself, it is a sign of the gathering of ḍākinīs.

original: khyi dang phag la sogs pa byung na dam tshig nyams pa yin te ngan /
analyzed: khyi dang phag la sogs pa byung na dam tshig nyams pa yin te ngan /
translated: If a dog, pig, and so on, appear, it is a sign of the deterioration of samaya.

original: gnod sbyin srin po la sogs pa'i gzugs su byung na sa ma ti thang lhod shor ba yin te ngan /
analyzed: gnod sbyin srin po la sogs pa'i gzugs su byung na sa ma ti thang lhod shor ba yin te ngan /
translated: If the forms of yakṣas, rākṣasas, and so on, appear, it is a sign of losing the balance of meditative concentration.

original: rtags dang mtshan ma ci byung yang bzang ba la dga' bar mi bya zhing mi dmigs par bya /
analyzed: rtags dang mtshan ma ci byung yang bzang ba la dga' bar mi bya zhing mi dmigs par bya /
translated: No matter what signs or indications arise, one should not be pleased by good signs and should not focus on them.

original: ngan pa la mi dga' ba mi bya zhing mi dmigs @328a * //
analyzed: ngan pa la mi dga' ba mi bya zhing mi dmigs @328a * //
translated: One should not be displeased by bad signs and should not focus on them.

original: par bya / mdor na gsang thub par bya zhing byung tshor ci byung ba thams cad bde ba chen por shes par byas la /
analyzed: par bya / mdor na gsang thub par bya zhing byung tshor ci byung ba thams cad bde ba chen por shes par byas la /
translated: In brief, one should maintain secrecy and recognize all that arises as great bliss.

original: de mi dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de mi dmigs par bya'o //
translated: One should not focus on that.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i 'jug pa'i rim pa lnga po'i don rtags dang mtshan ma dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i 'jug pa'i rim pa lnga po'i don rtags dang mtshan ma dang bcas pa /
translated: The meaning of the five stages of the yogi's practice, along with the signs and marks,🔽I, who am fortunate and have the right karma, have found this. May others also be like me.

original: las 'phro dang skal bar ldan pa bdag gis rnyed pa 'dis gzhan yang de ltar shog shig / rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen po dpal shes rab gsang ba'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: las 'phro dang skal bar ldan pa bdag gis rnyed pa 'dis gzhan yang de ltar shog shig / rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen po dpal shes rab gsang ba'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so//
translated: This was composed by the great lord of yogis, the glorious Śrī Sahajavajra.
